programme.title: Brainy Smurf, Friend To All Animals
programme.desc: Brainy dons his safari hat and roams the forest to do good deeds for animals. He mostly gives advice to the creatures but balks when he can really save the life of a wildcat being hunted by Gargamel. Nat gives Brainy the courage to free the cat from Gargamel's trap.

programme.title: How To Smurf A Rainbow
programme.desc: Mother Nature is too busy to conjure a rainbow for the Smurfs' festival, so Papa Smurf borrows her cookbook and mixes up the recipe himself. As there is no yellow available, they use the leprechaun's gold to produce a beautiful rainbow before Gargamel can steal it.

programme.title: The Masked Pie-Smurfer
programme.desc: When tempers flare, the Smurfs hire a masked pie thrower to get revenge on other Smurfs. Everyone becomes even angrier as pies fly and no one knows who's doing it. When Jokey is unmasked as the culprit, Papa defends him. He says that if all the Smurfs shared their feelings, they wouldn't need a secret pie thrower.

programme.title: Skyscraper Smurfs
programme.desc: Sure, a village of mushroom-shaped houses is nice and jolly... But not very modern, in Architect Smurf's view. What the Smurfs need is smurfdominium, a new, daring concept that will change the art of living forever...

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Fake Smurf: Hogatha turns herself into a Smurf, plotting revenge on the little people for destroying her magic locket. Papa Smurf outwits her and banishes her from the forest once more.

programme.title: The Smurfs And The Money Tree
programme.desc: The wicked wizard Gargamel has come up with yet another diabolical plan with the help of his mother, who isn't much nicer than him. He wants to tempt the Smurfs with money of which they have no notion. Will Greedy take the bait?

programme.title: Futuresmurfed
programme.desc: Balthazar the Enchanter is a man of vision. He knows that the times of alchemy are drawing to their end. The future belongs to those who will understand science...but how can he see into the future? Perhaps by kidnapping Father Time. The Smurfs will help to put things right after Little Thunder, a dinosaur, escapes through a gash in the fabric of time.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Adventures Of Robin Smurf: The Smurfs' theatrical production of 'Robin Smurf' comes to life as the legendary hero is portrayed by a really good actor...

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Golden Smurf Award: Hogatha disguises herself as the Golden Smurf Award to catch the Smurfs in order to use them as the main ingredient in her beauty cream. Vanity convinces her to try his recipe and before long, the wicked sorceress is covered with mud and sent careening over the hills into Gargamel's house.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Greedy Goes On Strike: Get up early in the morning, before any other Smurf is out of bed, to prepare a scrumptious Smurfberry muffin. Spend all morning on preparing Smurf delicacies for lunch. Than all afternoon to have dinner ready – and delicious – on time. And do you get so much as a thank you form the Smurfs? So Greedy Smurf quits. The Village is in trouble... And soon, so is Greedy.

programme.title: Essence Of Brainy
programme.desc: Brainy Smurf is not the same anymore. He is polite, considerate, modest and calls every other Smurf Sir or Madame. All the Smurfs are worried that Brainy has lost all that makes his personality. They ought to be worried, for Brainy has been the victim of a system called an Essence Remover that Scruple, Gargamel's apprentice, uses... But Brainy's essence is coming back!

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Clumsy Smurfs The Future: What a strange stone Clumsy has unearthed! In it, he can see events that are going to happen... Yet knowing part of the future sometimes brings bad luck!

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Wild And Woolly: The Smurflings accompany Woolly on his mission to shear wool for winter clothes. They must overcome obstacles such as Gargamel, a wolf and finally a shepherd boy who will not accept smurfberries as payment for the wool. The Smurflings and Woolly develop respect for one another through their travels.

programme.title: No Time For Smurfs
programme.desc: Handy, Brainy, Clumsy, and Smurfette discover the hourglass of time in a cave and due to their bungling, time spins erratically out of control for all of the Smurfs.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Garagmel's Time Trip: Gargamel steals Father Time's hourglass in an effort to travel into the past and destroy the Smurfs, whom he blames for his failure in life. His plans are thwarted when Bigmouth shows up and breaks the spell, which only lasts if Gargamel is not seen by anyone.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Prince And The Hopper: What is that strange talking frog that Morlock the Wizard sends all of Prince Theodore's soldiers to catch? Is it a demon frog, as he says, or something else? Truth will out when Smurfette and the Smurflings meet the frog. They help to change this frog back into Prince Theodore himself, for he's been the victim of a spell cast by Morlock.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Smurfs' Time Capsule: As the Smurfs busily build a time capsule for all of their talents, Papa Smurf frantically tries to unravel an ancient Druid riddle before disaster strikes the forest.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Marco Smurf And The Pepper Pirates: The Smurfs sail off in their sailing boat to save Marco Smurf, who has been captured at sea by Captain Pepper. Marina and a dolphin help to free Marco.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Grouchiest Game In Town: A strange little imp who is a master at games challenges the Smurfs to a contest. He turns the Smurflings into rigid game pieces and forces Grouchy, who never wins at games, into playing for the Smurflings' lives. Grouchy gains confidence, makes the right move, and frees the Smurfs.

programme.title: Gormandizing Greedy
programme.desc: Greedy overdoes it. He's getting heavier and heavier until his weight puts him in jeopardy. The evil Gargamel is going to catch him... Can Greedy be saved by Papa Smurf?

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Tick Tock Smurfs: The village of the Smurfs used to live without a clock. But now suddenly time becomes a precious commodity and Brainy Smurf designs a schedule to take advantage of the new Village clock... Can the Smurfs survive the attacks of time?

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Love Those Smurfs: A wicked sorceress casts a spell on the Smurfs, forcing them to love themselves and not each other. Vanity, who's always like that, was away at the time, but notices the change when he returns. He breaks the spell by getting all the Smurfs to eat humble pie baked by a wizard.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Hopping Cough Smurfs: The evil wizard Gargamel spreads the forest with the germs of the uncontrollable hopping cough. Baby Smurf is the first victim and all the Village of the Smurfs goes frantic with worry... Fortunately, Papa Smurf thinks there might be a cure.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - A Loss Of Smurfs: When the emergency call rings, all the Smurfs in the Village drop what they are doing and run to hear the news. But when Vanity Smurf calls for an assembly so that the Smurfs can admire his new hat, it is too much. They send him on his way out of the village, and Vanity has the bad luck of meeting Lofty, the Elf, who suggests a horrible mud bath...

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Last Smurfberry: Papa Smurf organizes a crew to sail to Smurfberry Island because Gargamel has killed all of the trees except one to trap the Smurfs. Gargamel follows them, but once more fails to catch them because the Witch of Smurfberry Island sends her nose-eating seagulls after them.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Baby Smurf Is Missing: Thinking Baby Smurf is a leprechaun, two poachers kidnap him and try to get the small one to tell them where his pot of gold is hidden. Papa Smurf organizes everyone to attack the villains with Smurfberry pies so Baby can escape.

programme.title: The First Telesmurf
programme.desc: Papa Smurf pours a magic potion over the new Smurf-melon patch, which instantly grows and grows all over the village and forest. The Smurfs use the blossoms as a telephone, but before Gargamel can trace their voices, the flowers turn into melons and telesmurf is no more.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Jokey's Funny Bone: Jealous of the attention Vanity Smurf receives when he breaks his toe, Jokey Smurf feigns sickness in hopes of getting recognition. Unfortunately, his ploy turns against him and instead of loving care all he receives is the proverbial pound of curse.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Garagmel's Time Trip: Gargamel steals Father Time's hourglass in an effort to travel into the past and destroy the Smurfs, whom he blames for his failure in life. His plans are thwarted when Bigmouth shows up and breaks the spell, which only lasts if Gargamel is not seen by anyone.

programme.title: Can't Smurf The Music
programme.desc: There is nothing the sorceress Chlorhydris hates so much as love in the world. She would like to see all love banished from the face of the Earth, and she's going to start with music. She puts a spell on a magic horn so that it will suck the music out of every song... especially the Smurfs' songs. Helped by their friend Laconia, the Smurfs may be able to resist Chlorhydris' evil plan...

programme.title: The Bad Place
programme.desc: What is this little moon coming from above? Why, it's a crater-pockmarked globe of mud inhabited by the Grimeys, a family of mud-splattering, mud-eating creatures from out there in the sky. Not all the Smurfs are enthusiastic about the visitors....

programme.title: Bringing Up Bigfeet
programme.desc: Remember Bigmouth, the ogre, and his lovely wife Bignose? They have a baby now: tiny (by ogre standards) Bigfeet. As the Smurflings Snappy, Slouchy and Nat, and of course the ever-willing Sassette are not entitled to baby-sit Baby Smurf, they volunteer to watch over Bigfeet, while its parents are at the Ogre Ball. The little Smurfs will get more than what they expected...

programme.title: The Smurfiest Of Friends
programme.desc: Brainy Smurf had one friend: Clumsy Smurf. But poor Clumsy is so, well, clumsy, that Brainy refuses to see him again. So now he is left without anyone willing to listen to him. Maybe Buddy, the good-looking imp met by chance near the Great Oak can be a pal for Brainy....

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Prince And The Hopper: What is that strange talking frog that Morlock the Wizard sends all of Prince Theodore's soldiers to catch? Is it a demon frog, as he says, or something else? Truth will out when Smurfette and the Smurflings meet the frog. They help to change this frog back into Prince Theodore himself, for he's been the victim of a spell cast by Morlock.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Tis The Season To Be Smurfy: This is Wild Smurf's first Christmas, and he's impressed by the decorations in the Village of the Smurfs. But Grandpa and Sassette are going to teach him the real meaning of Christmas when they help an old couple to live the most beautiful Christmas they've ever seen...

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Sideshow Smurfs: Clumsy and Smurfette are captured by the wicked Bombast, who plans to exhibit them in his sideshow. Papa Smurf hurries to their rescue and using the bungling Gargamel for interference is able to rescue his Smurfs.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - A Hovel Is Not A Home: In his search for a grander hovel, Gargamel looks in the Great Book of Spells to conjure up a new home. But all of his spells backfire and that convinces him that there's no place like home!

programme.title: The Smurfiest Of Friends
programme.desc: Brainy Smurf had one friend: Clumsy Smurf. But poor Clumsy is so, well, clumsy, that Brainy refuses to see him again. So now he is left without anyone willing to listen to him. Maybe Buddy, the good-looking imp met by chance near the Great Oak can be a pal for Brainy....

programme.title: It Came From Outer Smurf
programme.desc: Dreamy wants to encounter beings from outer space so much that no one believes him when he talks of having met one. Yet the arrival of this extraterrestrial is going to wreak havoc in the Smurf Village...

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Jokey's Cloak: What is in the box that's been found by Jokey Smurf? A cloak belonging to Wizlow the Magician gnome. And what sort of cloak? Jokey learns that it's a cloak of invisibility. Whoever wears it has a great opportunity of playing practical jokes... And guess what havoc an invisible Jokey is able to wreak on the Village. Yet if Wizlow parted with the cloak, there must be a reason...

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - A Hovel Is Not A Home: In his search for a grander hovel, Gargamel looks in the Great Book of Spells to conjure up a new home. But all of his spells backfire and that convinces him that there's no place like home!

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Baby's First Christmas: The wonderful joy of Christmas for Baby Smurf and everyone else is almost ruined by the evil Chlorhydris who puts a spell on Mr. Nicholas to stop him from spreading holiday cheer. Fortunately, Papa Smurf and his little blue creatures break the spell and Christmas spreads over the land once more.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Smurfs At Sea: Papa Smurf recalls Dreamy's exciting voyage on the high seas and his gripping adventures with sea turtles, whales, desert islands... and pirates!

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - A Loss Of Smurfs: When the emergency call rings, all the Smurfs in the Village drop what they are doing and run to hear the news. But when Vanity Smurf calls for an assembly so that the Smurfs can admire his new hat, it is too much. They send him on his way out of the village, and Vanity has the bad luck of meeting Lofty, the Elf, who suggests a horrible mud bath...

programme.title: The Smurfiest Of Friends
programme.desc: Brainy Smurf had one friend: Clumsy Smurf. But poor Clumsy is so, well, clumsy, that Brainy refuses to see him again. So now he is left without anyone willing to listen to him. Maybe Buddy, the good-looking imp met by chance near the Great Oak can be a pal for Brainy....

programme.title: The Baby Smurf
programme.desc: Gargamel turns himself into a Baby Smurf, to be adopted by the Smurfette. He causes complete chaos in the Smurf Village when he tries to blow it up with a time bomb! Papa Smurf discovers his evil plot and uses the explosive to send the wizard back to his dismal castle.

programme.title: Snappy's Way
programme.desc: Did you know that if you catch a troll, he may grant you one wish? It just happens that Aloysius the Troll gets caught in one of Gargamel's Smurf traps. Snappy Smurf sets him free and as a reward, gets to make all other Smurfs obey his every whim. Now this brings a lot of trouble to the Smurfs, as Smurflings, sometimes, ask for things that are not good for them... or anybody else.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Papa's Flying Bed: Gargamel casts a spell on Papa's new bed so anyone who sleeps in it is transported to the location of his dream. The drowsy Smurfs' fantasies lead them to a private ship, a castle and finally to Gargamel's. They escape when Clumsy falls asleep and dreams of home.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Smurfic Games: The Smurfs discover the spirit and joy of friendly competition when they hold their first "Smurfic Games". After a near miss with the troublesome cat Azrael, the Smurfs decide they need to get into better shape. Papa Smurf suggests that the Smurfs tone their bodies as well as sharpen their athletic abilities by inaugurating the "Smurfic Games".

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Baby's First Word: The Smurflings free the Smurfs from the clutches of Gargamel just in time to get Baby to its first word ceremony. Baby utters the word « Gargamel ». Papa Smurf says that this word indicates that Baby will one day become the Great Chief, as he is aware of the dangers in life.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Last Laugh: Gargamel has found a new diabolical scheme to get rid of the Smurfs: a glittering powder that is going to reduce them to helpless laughter...

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Paradise Smurfed: Lazy dreams he is on Paradise Island and free from all the work Papa Smurf inflicts on him. His fantasy turns into a nightmare that sends him eagerly back to work once more.

programme.title: They'Re Smurfing Our Song
programme.desc: Gargamel casts a spell on Woody's magical pipe to change its music from good to evil. Gargamel captures the Smurfs, but Sassette saves them by telling Gargamel that she loves him. He plays the pipe but the music fades as Gargamel is overcome with feelings of love and releases the Smurfs.

programme.title: Brainy Smurf, Friend To All Animals
programme.desc: Brainy dons his safari hat and roams the forest to do good deeds for animals. He mostly gives advice to the creatures but balks when he can really save the life of a wildcat being hunted by Gargamel. Nat gives Brainy the courage to free the cat from Gargamel's trap.

programme.title: The Gargoyle Of Quarrel Castle
programme.desc: In Quarrel Castle, you almost never hear a kind word. Both Selwyn the Warlock and Tallulah, his witch-mate, spend their time quarrelling. Tharp, their pet gargoyle, takes refuge in the Village of Smurfs. But something terrible is going to happen....

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Papa's Last Spell: Papa Smurf has been elected Wizard of the Year, and the evil wizard Gargamel is beside himself with jealousy. He will see to it that Papa's powers all disappear. And then, he is sure to catch all the Smurfs and celebrate with a big feast... But now, would Papa Smurf let such a bad thing happen? Surely not, Papa finds a way to foil Gargamel's plan...

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Love Those Smurfs: A wicked sorceress casts a spell on the Smurfs, forcing them to love themselves and not each other. Vanity, who's always like that, was away at the time, but notices the change when he returns. He breaks the spell by getting all the Smurfs to eat humble pie baked by a wizard.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Waste Not, Smurf Not: Growing, harvesting and preparing food takes up much of the Smurfs' time. Handy invents a machine that farms and processes food. But this wonderful invention has its drawbacks...

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Smurfette's Dancing Shoes: An evil imp gives Smurfette dancing shoes and then tricks her into promising to marry him. All her little friends rush to her rescue and Papa Smurf magically puts the dancing shoes on the imp. He is forced to dance off into the night.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - A Clockwork Smurf: Handy has built a very complex Smurf machine that does everything. It proves dangerous when it nearly destroys the village, but comes in useful when, with the help of the other Smurfs, it saves the young prince Gerard's kingdom from the queen aunt Imperia's dastardly intentions.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Smurfs' Time Capsule: As the Smurfs busily build a time capsule for all of their talents, Papa Smurf frantically tries to unravel an ancient Druid riddle before disaster strikes the forest.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Hefty's Heart: Gargamel infects Hefty's heart with hate and then uses the little Smurf as a decoy for the others. Fortunately, Hefty's love overcomes his hate and he helps his little friends escape from Gargamel's clutches.

programme.title: Don Smurfo
programme.desc: Everyone has their own dreams. That of Smurfette is to meet the legendary Don Smurfo, the dashing, witty, swashbuckling hero of many an engrossing tale. The Smurfs shrug at this infatuation. But when a real-life Don Smurfo appears in the village and Smurfette snubs them all in favor of the bragging stranger, they take the matter a little more seriously.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Supersmurf: Bigmouth steals the Smurfs' winter food supply and Brainy concocts one of Papa Smurf's magic strength potions so he can fight the greedy giant. The super formula wears off, but Papa Smurf works a fast switch, replacing the food with rocks and Bigmouth is none the wiser.

programme.title: Return To Don Smurfo
programme.desc: When a drop of Papa Smurf's new potion spills on the Smurflings' adventure book, the fictional hero springs to life. The dashing Don Smurfo, willing to rid the Smurf of the evil Gargamel, gallantly captures him...

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Chip Off The Old Smurf: Disaster strikes when Brainy and Baby mix up Papa Smurf's formulas, leaving them powerless before an army of hungry locusts unleashed on the forest by Gargamel.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Dark-Ness Monster: When Brainy loses his glasses, he drops things, runs into objects, and becomes just as helpless as Clumsy, who now has to read to Brainy and help him get around. This experience makes Brainy feel guilty for the way he always made fun of Clumsy. He treats him with more respect once he receives a new pair of glasses.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Kow-Tow, We Won't Bow: Smurfette leads the Smurflings on a nature hike, but Puppy gets too far ahead and they chase him into the land of the Wartmongers. King Bullrush captures them in bubbles and imprisons them. A group of rebels rescue the Smurflings and they escape on the back of Puppy.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Prince And The Hopper: What is that strange talking frog that Morlock the Wizard sends all of Prince Theodore's soldiers to catch? Is it a demon frog, as he says, or something else? Truth will out when Smurfette and the Smurflings meet the frog. They help to change this frog back into Prince Theodore himself, for he's been the victim of a spell cast by Morlock.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Tick Tock Smurfs: The village of the Smurfs used to live without a clock. But now suddenly time becomes a precious commodity and Brainy Smurf designs a schedule to take advantage of the new Village clock... Can the Smurfs survive the attacks of time?

programme.title: He Who Smurfs Last
programme.desc: Jokey's practical jokes go too far when Chlorhydris is the victim of one. She gets her revenge on the Smurfs by creating a spell to steal their sense of humor. Grouchy, who had no sense of humor to begin with, breaks the spell by getting back the humor potion.

programme.title: Futuresmurfed
programme.desc: Balthazar the Enchanter is a man of vision. He knows that the times of alchemy are drawing to their end. The future belongs to those who will understand science...but how can he see into the future? Perhaps by kidnapping Father Time. The Smurfs will help to put things right after Little Thunder, a dinosaur, escapes through a gash in the fabric of time.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Unsound Smurf: In an effort to give Papa some quiet time, Brainy uses one of Papa's spells to create a magical sound barrier around the village. Papa cannot reverse the spell and sends the Smurflings, who are trapped outside the Village, to a noisemaker. Baby takes a bottle of sound from the noisemaker, which breaks the barrier.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Comet Is Coming!: Papa's note to the Smurfs about viewing a comet is delivered torn. The Smurfs read only the first part and think their world is coming to an end. They plan how to spend their last day until Papa returns to clear up the misunderstanding and assure them that they are safe.

programme.title: Better Together
programme.desc: Discussing faith, family, friends and more, while building a community of women committed to living life together and making the world a better place.

programme.title: Andrew Wommack: Gospel Truth
programme.desc: Hebrews: Living in the New Covenant Reality. Many Christians aren't living in the freedom that Jesus purchased for us. Most people mix the old covenant with the new covenant which shouldn't be done.

programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: "The 700 Club," which first broadcast in 1966, is a newsmagazine featuring guests, news, music, testimonies and spiritual stories from a Christian perspective. News stories are frequently related to Bible passages or deal with Christian lifestyle issues. Hosts of the long-running religious show include televangelist (and former candidate for the Republican presidential nomination) Pat Robertson, Terry Meeuwsen and Gordon Robertson, son of Pat. News items of interest are delivered by anchor John Jessup.

programme.title: Turning Point With Dr. David Jeremiah
programme.desc: In this weekly program, Dr. David Jeremiah delivers practical messages to the congregation at the Shadow Mountain Community Church in San Diego. Also featured is music from the Shadow Mountain Community Church Choir and Orchestra, as well as performances by musical guests that have included Steve Green and Charles Billingsley. Men and women who have been impacted by the Turning Point ministry also share their stories with viewers. During the month of December, "Turning Point" usually features special Christmas programming.

programme.title: Steven Furtick
programme.desc: From Elevation Church in Charlotte, N.C., Pastor Steven Furtick offers inspirational messages through his sermons.

programme.title: Harvest With Pastor Greg Laurie
programme.desc: Join Pastor Greg Laurie for a time of encouragement, worship, and Bible study.

programme.title: Hagee Ministries
programme.desc: John Hagee is the founder and senior pastor of Cornerstone Church in San Antonio, Texas.; John Hagee Ministries telecasts his national television and radio teachings throughout America and internationally; the mission of John Hagee Ministries is to take the Gospel to all the world and to all generations.

programme.title: New Season with Samuel Rodriguez
programme.desc: Pastor Sam aims to usher in a "New Season" where individuals and families will no longer live in failure or merely survive, but thrive for the glory of Jesus.

programme.title: Charlie Kirk Today
programme.desc: Join Charlie Kirk as he breaks down the news, challenges the mainstream narrative and delivers commentary on faith, culture and politics; no spin, no censorship, just the truth.

programme.title: Allen Jackson NOW
programme.desc: A lifeline for a struggling and anxious nation; a guiding hand for those who are not ready to give up, and for those who want to find a way past the negativity before things get worse; searching for the wisdom embedded in a Christian World View.

programme.title: Stakelbeck Tonight
programme.desc: Host Erick Stakelbeck takes viewers around the world -- from Jerusalem to London to Washington, D.C., and points beyond -- with cutting-edge commentary, analysis and interviews focusing on ever-changing events and why they matter.

programme.title: Praise
programme.desc: Matt and Laurie Crouch host Rabbi Jonathan Cahn for a compelling conversation filled with prophetic mysteries, biblical revelations, and urgent messages for today. He shares how ancient truths connect to current events from his new book The Avatar.

programme.title: Takeaways With Kirk Cameron
programme.desc: Kirk Cameron is joined by television host Kathie Lee Gifford and speaker John Bevere about God's calling and purpose in our lives and fulfilling it with the gifts He has given us.

programme.title: Harvest With Pastor Greg Laurie
programme.desc: Join Pastor Greg Laurie for a time of encouragement, worship, and Bible study.

programme.title: Stakelbeck Tonight
programme.desc: Host Erick Stakelbeck takes viewers around the world -- from Jerusalem to London to Washington, D.C., and points beyond -- with cutting-edge commentary, analysis and interviews focusing on ever-changing events and why they matter.

programme.title: Praise
programme.desc: Matt and Laurie Crouch host Rabbi Jonathan Cahn for a compelling conversation filled with prophetic mysteries, biblical revelations, and urgent messages for today. He shares how ancient truths connect to current events from his new book The Avatar.

programme.title: Joseph Prince
programme.desc: Find hope even in your darkest days and toughest seasons through this encouraging program with Joseph.

programme.title: Charlie Kirk Today
programme.desc: Join Charlie Kirk as he breaks down the news, challenges the mainstream narrative and delivers commentary on faith, culture and politics; no spin, no censorship, just the truth.

programme.title: Takeaways With Kirk Cameron
programme.desc: Kirk Cameron is joined by television host Kathie Lee Gifford and speaker John Bevere about God's calling and purpose in our lives and fulfilling it with the gifts He has given us.

programme.title: Huckabee's Health Secret
programme.desc: Unlocking the healing wisdom woven through scripture and science; Mike Huckabee goes on a transformative journey to God-inspired wellness.

programme.title: Life Today With James Robison
programme.desc: James Robison is a former preacher who changed directions in his life several years ago and began hosting this television show alongside his wife, Betty, in order to reach out to help more people. This daily religious and self-help program welcomes guests who tell how they have successfully overcome difficulties in their lives by following God's word -- with the hope of encouraging others to do the same and look to God for help and guidance in times of need. The Robisons provide viewers with Bible-based advice to help them deal with everyday problems.

programme.title: Jordan Rubin: The Biblio Diet Book
programme.desc: Sheila Walsh welcomes Jordan Rubin, founder of Ancient Nutrition and author of "The Maker's Diet"; they discuss Jordan's new book, "The Biblio Diet," exploring its fresh insights on health and wellness.

programme.title: Allen Jackson Ministries
programme.desc: What's the best way to prepare for the uncertain future? Trust God with our resources! Pastor Allen Jackson talks about biblical principles surrounding the money, resources, and possessions.

programme.title: Steven Furtick
programme.desc: From Elevation Church in Charlotte, N.C., Pastor Steven Furtick offers inspirational messages through his sermons.

programme.title: Joyce Meyer Enjoying Everyday Life
programme.desc: Are you missing out on the good life Jesus died to give you? Joyce tells how to go beyond salvation and start enjoying every benefit God intended for you, beginning now!

programme.title: Andrew Wommack: Gospel Truth
programme.desc: Hebrews: Living in the New Covenant Reality. Many Christians aren't living in the freedom that Jesus purchased for us. Most people mix the old covenant with the new covenant which shouldn't be done.

programme.title: Turning Point With Dr. David Jeremiah
programme.desc: David Jeremiah sits down with Sheila Walsh to answer common questions about heaven and eternity.

programme.title: Joseph Prince
programme.desc: Joseph Prince is a leading voice in proclaiming the gospel around the world through his ministry.

programme.title: Robert Jeffress

programme.desc: "The 700 Club," which first broadcast in 1966, is a newsmagazine featuring guests, news, music, testimonies and spiritual stories from a Christian perspective. News stories are frequently related to Bible passages or deal with Christian lifestyle issues. Hosts of the long-running religious show include televangelist (and former candidate for the Republican presidential nomination) Pat Robertson, Terry Meeuwsen and Gordon Robertson, son of Pat. News items of interest are delivered by anchor John Jessup.

programme.title: Turning Point With Dr. David Jeremiah
programme.desc: David Jeremiah teaches that heaven will be vibrant, joyful, and full of purpose; from "The Promise of Heaven" series.

programme.title: Steven Furtick
programme.desc: From Elevation Church in Charlotte, N.C., Pastor Steven Furtick offers inspirational messages through his sermons.

programme.title: Harvest With Pastor Greg Laurie
programme.desc: Join Pastor Greg Laurie for a time of encouragement, worship, and Bible study.

programme.title: Hagee Ministries
programme.desc: John Hagee is the founder and senior pastor of Cornerstone Church in San Antonio, Texas.; John Hagee Ministries telecasts his national television and radio teachings throughout America and internationally; the mission of John Hagee Ministries is to take the Gospel to all the world and to all generations.

programme.title: The Eric Metaxas Radio Show
programme.desc: Offering compelling perspective on American culture, political life, and stories making news around the corner and across the globe.

programme.title: Charlie Kirk Today
programme.desc: Join Charlie Kirk as he breaks down the news, challenges the mainstream narrative and delivers commentary on faith, culture and politics; no spin, no censorship, just the truth.

programme.title: Allen Jackson NOW
programme.desc: A lifeline for a struggling and anxious nation; a guiding hand for those who are not ready to give up, and for those who want to find a way past the negativity before things get worse; searching for the wisdom embedded in a Christian World View.

programme.title: Charlie Kirk Today
programme.desc: Join Charlie Kirk as he breaks down the news, challenges the mainstream narrative and delivers commentary on faith, culture and politics; no spin, no censorship, just the truth.

programme.title: Gaither Gospel Hour
programme.desc: The classic quartet harmonies of Canton Junction quickly spreads nationally, garnering record sales numbers, awards and #1 hits.

programme.title: Jordan Rubin: MCP Advanced Muscle
programme.desc: Sheila Walsh hosts Jordan Rubin in Nashville.

programme.title: God's Appointed Times With Rabbi Jason Sobel
programme.desc: Messianic rabbi Jason Sobel explores biblical holidays, showing how these sacred times of the year, rich in significance, can provide a deeper understanding of faith.

programme.title: Boots on the Ground
programme.desc: Boots on the Ground focuses on real-time updates from the frontlines of Israel's military operations. It delivers factual, in-depth information about the ongoing war, providing viewers with clear insight into tactical maneuvers and military events.

programme.title: Rick Warren: The Purpose Driven Life
programme.desc: With more than 35 million copies sold, and more than 70 translations available, The Purpose Driven Life is far more than just a book, a it's the road map for spiritual journeys; Rick uncovers how to find purpose in pain.

programme.title: Scott Hannen: Nano Nutrients
programme.desc: Scott Hannen introduces his formula called Nano Nutrients, a vitamin spray which allows nutrients to absorb at the microscopic level.

programme.title: Vinia
programme.desc: Governor Huckabee interviews soldiers and veterans who use VINIA, a red grape supplement for circulation; viewers hear how VINIA helps their physical strength and mental alertness.

programme.title: Allen Jackson Ministries
programme.desc: What's the best way to prepare for the uncertain future? Trust God with our resources! Pastor Allen Jackson talks about biblical principles surrounding the money, resources, and possessions.

programme.title: Taking Care of Business
programme.desc: In America, one in every three adults is considered obese; this dangerous health crisis continues to grow to epidemic proportions.

programme.title: Joel Osteen
programme.desc: Author and evangelist Joel Osteen spreads his message of love and hope as he preaches at the 30,000-plus member Lakewood Church in Houston. The program can be seen in more than 100 countries. Osteen urges people to live at their full potential and form a close relationship with God.

programme.title: Nocturne
programme.desc: Detective Joe Warne (George Raft) is investigating the death of a successful composer. While Joe's colleagues believe that the man killed himself, Joe isn't so convinced. After some poking around, Joe discovers that the composer was involved with numerous women (Lynn Bari, Virginia Huston), and many seem to have good reasons to want their former lover dead. Though Joe's superiors command him to stop investigating, he becomes so engrossed in the case that he will stop at nothing to solve it.

programme.title: The Sea of Grass
programme.desc: Lutie Cameron (Katharine Hepburn) arrives in New Mexico, having married cattleman James Brewton (Spencer Tracy) after a short courtship. She finds that her husband is considered a tyrant by locals for jealously guarding his million acres of land, the "Sea of Grass," against homesteaders. Lutie is unfaithful to him with his enemy, liberal lawyer Brice Chamberlain (Melvyn Douglas), and conceives a son. When James finds out, he orders her to leave -- without her two children.

programme.title: Blitz
programme.desc: A tough cop (Jason Statham) goes after a serial killer who targets police officers.

programme.title: Rebel Without a Cause
programme.desc: After moving to a new town, troublemaking teen Jim Stark (James Dean) is supposed to have a clean slate, although being the new kid in town brings its own problems. While searching for some stability, Stark forms a bond with a disturbed classmate, Plato (Sal Mineo), and falls for local girl Judy (Natalie Wood). However, Judy is the girlfriend of neighborhood tough, Buzz (Corey Allen). When Buzz violently confronts Jim and challenges him to a drag race, the new kid's real troubles begin.

programme.title: Strangers on a Train
programme.desc: In Alfred Hitchcock's adaptation of Patricia Highsmith's thriller, tennis star Guy Haines (Farley Granger) is enraged by his trampy wife's refusal to finalize their divorce so he can wed senator's daughter Anne (Ruth Roman). He strikes up a conversation with a stranger, Bruno Anthony (Robert Walker), and unwittingly sets in motion a deadly chain of events. Psychopathic Bruno kills Guy's wife, then urges Guy to reciprocate by killing Bruno's father. Meanwhile, Guy is murder suspect number one.

programme.title: Hostage Radio
programme.desc: Jarvis Dolan is a London talk-show host who plans to reveal a bombshell news story on the air. But when two masked intruders take over the studio, they force him to read their script -- or face the violent consequences.

programme.title: Mutiny on the Bounty
programme.desc: On a sea voyage to transport breadfruit to Jamaica, English Captain Bligh (Trevor Howard) abuses his crew and officers enough to anger his 1st Lieutenant, Fletcher Christian (Marlon Brando). When they reach their destination, tensions ease and the crew luxuriates in island life until Bligh claps several men in irons for trying to desert. On the trip home, further indignities inspire Christian to stage a mutiny and set Bligh and those loyal to him afloat in a row boat.

programme.desc: Hollywood celebrities give insight into their personal and professional lives, and open up about upcoming projects.

programme.title: On the Line
programme.desc: A former detective falls victim to a phone scam. He infiltrates the phishing organization and meets the mastermind behind the crime.

programme.title: Key Largo
programme.desc: This classic film noir by John Huston stars Humphrey Bogart as World War II vet Frank McCloud. Visiting Key Largo to pay his respects to the family of his late war buddy, McCloud attempts to comfort his comrade's widow, Nora (Lauren Bacall), and father, James Temple (Lionel Barrymore), who operate a hotel. But McCloud realizes that mobsters, led by the infamous Johnny Rocco (Edward G. Robinson), are staying in the hotel. When the criminals take over the establishment, conflict is inevitable.

programme.title: Mister Roberts
programme.desc: Bittersweet film about a supply officer aboard a decrepit cargo ship during World War II who yearns for a transfer into a combat zone but is thwarted by the ship's captain, a petty tyrant. Forced to endure various humiliations in exchange for privileges, the crew engage in minor acts of resistance, and look to Mr. Roberts for inspiration and moral support. Based on the hit Broadway play.

programme.title: Julius Caesar
programme.desc: Brutus (James Mason) is convinced by a scheming band of Roman senators, led by Caius Cassius (John Gielgud), that his dear friend Julius Caesar (Louis Calhern) intends to dissolve the republic and install himself as monarch, and he joins a conspiracy to assassinate him. Brutus stirringly defends his actions, but when Mark Antony (Marlon Brando) responds with a speech that plays upon the crowd's love for their fallen leader, a battle between the two factions is assured.

programme.title: The Imitation Game
programme.desc: In 1939, newly created British intelligence agency MI6 recruits Cambridge mathematics alumnus Alan Turing (Benedict Cumberbatch) to crack Nazi codes, including Enigma -- which cryptanalysts had thought unbreakable. Turing's team, including Joan Clarke (Keira Knightley), analyze Enigma messages while he builds a machine to decipher them. Turing and team finally succeed and become heroes, but in 1952, the quiet genius encounters disgrace when authorities reveal he is gay and send him to prison.

programme.title: The Maltese Falcon
programme.desc: In this noir classic, detective Sam Spade (Humphrey Bogart) gets more than he bargained for when he takes a case brought to him by a beautiful but secretive woman (Mary Astor). As soon as Miss Wonderly shows up, trouble follows as Sam's partner is murdered and Sam is accosted by a man (Peter Lorre) demanding he locate a valuable statuette. Sam, entangled in a dangerous web of crime and intrigue, soon realizes he must find the one thing they all seem to want: the bejeweled Maltese falcon.

programme.title: The Young Kieslowski
programme.desc: A college student (Haley Lu Richardson) becomes pregnant with twins following a one-night stand with a fellow virgin (Ryan Malgarini).

programme.title: Esperando la carroza
programme.desc: Mama Cora's four children argue over who should be forced to care for her in her old age.

programme.title: Rachel, Rachel
programme.desc: Written off as a spinster, 35-year-old schoolteacher Rachel Cameron (Joanne Woodward) lives with her widowed mother above a funeral parlor in rural Connecticut. Repressed by the community and given to despondency, Rachel spends her time daydreaming, buoyed by her lesbian best friend, Calla (Estelle Parsons). A religious experience begins a subtle awakening in Rachel, and when a childhood friend returns to town for his father's funeral, she experiences real, driving passion.

programme.title: La Ventana
programme.desc: When young Tommy (Bobby Driscoll) sneaks out of his bedroom and onto the fire escape of his tenement building, he sees two neighbors, Joe (Paul Stewart) and Jean Kellerson (Ruth Roman), murder a sailor (Richard Benedict). Tommy, who has been reprimanded before by his parents for telling phony stories, informs his mother (Barbara Hale) of the crime, but she does not believe him. After his mother leaves to attend to a sick relative, Tommy worries that the Kellersons will try to kill him, too.

programme.title: StarDog and TurboCat
programme.desc: Launched into space in 1969, a loyal dog crash-lands in a small town where pets are no longer welcome. Desperate and confused, he soon recruits the help of a tech-savvy cat to help him reunite with his beloved owner.

programme.title: The Philadelphia Story
programme.desc: This classic romantic comedy focuses on Tracy Lord (Katharine Hepburn), a Philadelphia socialite who has split from her husband, C.K. Dexter Haven (Cary Grant), due both to his drinking and to her overly demanding nature. As Tracy prepares to wed the wealthy George Kittredge (John Howard), she crosses paths with both Dexter and prying reporter Macaulay Connor (James Stewart). Unclear about her feelings for all three men, Tracy must decide whom she truly loves.

programme.title: The Brink
programme.desc: A reckless police inspector is on a mission to crack down on a criminal's gold smuggling scheme.

programme.title: Minority Report
programme.desc: Based on a story by famed science fiction writer Philip K. Dick, "Minority Report" is an action-detective thriller set in Washington D.C. in 2054, where police utilize a psychic technology to arrest and convict murderers before they commit their crime. Tom Cruise plays the head of this Precrime unit and is himself accused of the future murder of a man he hasn't even met.

programme.desc: A tough Hong Kong cop's teenage daughter disappears in Pattaya. He goes to Thailand to find her and must deal with corrupt cops, but an honest one helps him track down culprits involved in illegal organ trafficking.

programme.title: Back to Bataan
programme.desc: This World War II film sees American army colonel Joseph Madden (John Wayne) stationed in the Philippines with much of his military support forced out of the region by Japanese troops. Despite the grim situation, the tenacious Madden attempts to rally Filipino guerrilla fighters to continue assaults on the Japanese. Among Madden's band of soldiers is Captain Andres Bonifacio (Anthony Quinn), who struggles with the burden of being the grandson of a war hero.

programme.title: Brothers Karamazov
programme.desc: Based on Fyodor Dostoevsky's novel, Fyodor Karamazov (Lee J. Cobb) is a wealthy and controlling father who must choose an heir among his four sons. Dmitri (Yul Brynner), the oldest son, is engaged to Katya (Claire Bloom) but starts seeing his father's mistress, Grushenka (Maria Schell). The other brothers, Ivan (Richard Basehart), Alexey (William Shatner) and half-brother Smerdyakov (Albert Salmi), all have designs on the inheritance, ultimately leading to betrayal and murder.

programme.title: Quo Vadis
programme.desc: Returning from a military campaign abroad, General Marcus Vinicius (Robert Taylor) discovers that a new religion has taken hold in Rome: Christianity. When Vinicius encounters Lygia (Deborah Kerr), a follower of the strange religion, he quickly becomes smitten and tries to win her affections. Lygia is reluctant due to their differing beliefs. Complicating matters is the crazed Emperor Nero (Peter Ustinov), who blames the Christians for his own burning of Rome, beginning a wave of persecution.

programme.title: Minority Report

programme.title: Pitch Perfect 2

All seems well until a botched Lincoln Center performance for the president leads to a scandal that strips them of their performing duties, causing internal tension and strife. With the world championships on the horizon in Copenhagen, Denmark, the women must get their act together for their one and only shot at redemption.

programme.title: Pitch Perfect 3
programme.desc: After the highs of winning the world championships, the Bellas find themselves split apart and discovering there aren't job prospects for making music with your mouth. But when they get the chance to reunite for an overseas USO tour, the group of nerds comes together to make some music one last time.

programme.title: Pitch Perfect
programme.desc: College student Beca (Anna Kendrick) knows she does not want to be part of a clique, but that's exactly where she finds herself after arriving at her new school. Thrust in among mean gals, nice gals and just plain weird gals, Beca finds that the only thing they have in common is how well they sing together. She takes the women of the group out of their comfort zone of traditional arrangements and into a world of amazing harmonic combinations in a fight to the top of college music competitions.

programme.title: Prometheus
programme.desc: The discovery of a clue to mankind's origins on Earth leads a team of explorers to the darkest parts of the universe. Two brilliant young scientists lead the expedition. Shaw (Noomi Rapace) hopes that they will meet a race of benevolent, godlike beings who will in some way verify her religious beliefs, while Holloway (Logan Marshall-Green) is out to debunk any spiritual notions. However, neither the scientists nor their shipmates are prepared for the unimaginable terrors that await them.

programme.title: Alien: Covenant
programme.desc: Bound for a remote planet on the far side of the galaxy, members (Katherine Waterston, Billy Crudup) of the colony ship Covenant discover what they think to be an uncharted paradise. While there, they meet David (Michael Fassbender), the synthetic survivor of the doomed Prometheus expedition. The mysterious world soon turns dark and dangerous when a hostile alien life-form forces the crew into a deadly fight for survival.

programme.title: Alien
programme.desc: In deep space, the crew of the commercial starship Nostromo is awakened from their cryo-sleep capsules halfway through their journey home to investigate a distress call from an alien vessel. The terror begins when the crew encounters a nest of eggs inside the alien ship. An organism from inside an egg leaps out and attaches itself to one of the crew, causing him to fall into a coma.

programme.title: Alien: Romulus
programme.desc: Space colonizers come face to face with the most terrifying life-form in the universe while scavenging the deep ends of a derelict space station.

programme.title: Aliens
programme.desc: After floating in space for 57 years, Lt. Ripley's (Sigourney Weaver) shuttle is found by a deep space salvage team. Upon arriving at LV-426, the marines find only one survivor, a nine year old girl named Newt (Carrie Henn). But even these battle-hardened marines with all the latest weaponry are no match for the hundreds of aliens that have invaded the colony.

programme.title: Alien 3
programme.desc: Ellen Ripley (Sigourney Weaver) is the only survivor when she crash lands on Fiorina 161, a bleak wasteland inhabited by former inmates of the planet's maximum security prison. Once again, Ripley must face skepticism and the alien as it hunts down the prisoners and guards. Without weapons or modern technology of any kind, Ripley leads the men into battle against the terrifying creature.

programme.title: Fantastic Four
programme.desc: Transported to an alternate universe, four young outsiders gain superhuman powers as they alter their physical form in shocking ways. Reed Richards becomes Mr. Fantastic, able to stretch and twist his body at will, while pal Ben Grimm gains immense strength as the Thing. Johnny Storm becomes the Human Torch, able to control and project fire, while his sister Sue becomes the Invisible Woman. Together, the team must harness their new abilities to prevent Doctor Doom from destroying the Earth.

programme.title: Doctor Strange
programme.desc: Dr. Stephen Strange's (Benedict Cumberbatch) life changes after a car accident robs him of the use of his hands. When traditional medicine fails him, he looks for healing, and hope, in a mysterious enclave. He quickly learns that the enclave is at the front line of a battle against unseen dark forces bent on destroying reality. Before long, Strange is forced to choose between his life of fortune and status or leave it all behind to defend the world as the most powerful sorcerer in existence.

programme.title: Thor: Ragnarok
programme.desc: Imprisoned on the other side of the universe, the mighty Thor finds himself in a deadly gladiatorial contest that pits him against the Hulk, his former ally and fellow Avenger. Thor's quest for survival leads him in a race against time to prevent the all-powerful Hela from destroying his home world and the Asgardian civilization.

programme.title: Black Panther
programme.desc: After the death of his father, T'Challa returns home to the African nation of Wakanda to take his rightful place as king. When a powerful enemy suddenly reappears, T'Challa's mettle as king -- and as Black Panther -- gets tested when he's drawn into a conflict that puts the fate of Wakanda and the entire world at risk. Faced with treachery and danger, the young king must rally his allies and release the full power of Black Panther to defeat his foes and secure the safety of his people.

programme.title: Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3
programme.desc: Still reeling from the loss of Gamora, Peter Quill must rally his team to defend the universe and protect one of their own. If the mission is not completely successful, it could possibly lead to the end of the Guardians as we know them.

programme.title: X-Men
programme.desc: They are children of the atom, homo superior, the next link in the chain of evolution. Each was born with a unique genetic mutation, which at puberty manifested itself in extraordinary powers. In a world filled with hate and prejudice, they are feared by those who cannot accept their differences. Led by Xavier the X-Men fight to protect a world that fears them. They are locked in a battle with former colleague and friend, Magneto who believes humans and mutants should never co-exist.

programme.title: X2
programme.desc: Stryker (Brian Cox), a villianous former Army commander, holds the key to Wolverine's (Hugh Jackman) past and the future of the X-Men. This threat re-ignites the call for a mutant registration act. Stryker starts a full-out assault on Professor Xavier's (Patrick Stewart) mansion and school. After escaping his plastic cell, Magneto (Ian McKellen) proposes a partnership with Xavier and the X-Men to combat this new formidable enemy they both have in common.

programme.title: X-Men: The Last Stand
programme.desc: The discovery of a cure for mutations leads to a turning point for Mutants (Hugh Jackman, Halle Berry, Famke Janssen, Anna Paquin, Rebecca Romijn, Kelsey Grammer). They may now choose to give up their powers and become fully human or retain their uniqueness and remain isolated. War looms between the followers of Charles Xavier (Patrick Stewart), who preaches tolerance, and those of Magneto (Ian McKellen), who advocates survival of the fittest.

programme.title: The Wolverine
programme.desc: Lured to a Japan he hasn't seen since World War II, century-old mutant Wolverine (Hugh Jackman) finds himself in a shadowy realm of yakuza and samurai. Wolverine is pushed to his physical and emotional brink when he is forced to go on the run with a powerful industrialist's daughter (Tao Okamoto) and is confronted -- for the first time -- with the prospect of death. As he struggles to rediscover the hero within himself, he must grapple with powerful foes and the ghosts of his own haunted past.

programme.title: X-Men: Days of Future Past
programme.desc: Convinced that mutants pose a threat to humanity, Dr. Bolivar Trask (Peter Dinklage) develops the Sentinels, enormous robotic weapons that can detect a mutant gene and zero in on that person. In the 21st century, the Sentinels have evolved into highly efficient killing machines. With mutants now facing extinction, Wolverine (Hugh Jackman) volunteers to go back in time and rally the X-Men of the past to help change a pivotal moment in history and thereby save their future.

programme.title: X-Men: Apocalypse
programme.desc: Worshiped as a god since the dawn of civilization, the immortal Apocalypse (Oscar Isaac) becomes the first and most powerful mutant. Awakening after thousands of years, he recruits the disheartened Magneto (Michael Fassbender) and other mutants to create a new world order. As the fate of the Earth hangs in the balance, Professor X (James McAvoy) and Raven (Jennifer Lawrence) lead a team of young X-Men to stop their seemingly invincible nemesis from destroying mankind.

Soon, youngest daughter Maddy (Kennedi Clements) begins talking to an imaginary friend, or so the family thinks. programme.title: Armageddon

This leads him to renowned driller Harry Stamper (Bruce Willis), who agrees to helm the dangerous space mission provided he can bring along his own hotshot crew. Among them is the cocksure A.J. (Ben Affleck), who Harry thinks isn't good enough for his daughter (Liv Tyler), until the mission proves otherwise.

programme.title: Con Air: Unrated Extended Edition
programme.desc: Just-paroled army ranger Cameron Poe (Nicolas Cage) is headed back to his wife (Monica Potter), but must fly home aboard a prison transport flight dubbed "Jailbird" with some of the worst criminals living. Along with Diamond Dog (Ving Rhames) and Baby-O (Mykelti Williamson), genius serial killer Cyrus "The Virus" Grissom (John Malkovich) unleashes a violent escape plot in mid-flight. Secretly working with U.S. Marshall Vince Larkin (John Cusack), Poe tries to foil Grissom's plan.

programme.title: Black Panther: Wakanda Forever

To evade Ronan, Quill is forced into an uneasy truce with four disparate misfits: gun-toting Rocket Raccoon, treelike-humanoid Groot, enigmatic Gamora, and vengeance-driven Drax the Destroyer. But when he discovers the orb's true power and the cosmic threat it poses, Quill must rally his ragtag group to save the universe.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: "It's Mopar or No Car" for Mark Worman and his Graveyard Carz ghouls. They're game for any repair or restoration job, as long as it's in the Mopar mold -- a Chrysler muscle car from the late 1960s or early '70s. The series follows the progress to get the racing classics -- some left for dead in a scrap heap -- across the proverbial finish line, which to muscle car specialist Worman means nothing less than perfect restorations. After all, too much beauty exists in quality Detroit automobiles to let them go to rust.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: When a local car dealer wants to bring back the car of his youth, he enlists Mark to create an identical twin to his 1969 Road Runner; this car will have one or two add-ons, including a sport hood treatment.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: For the first time, the car is revealed backwards; beginning with the final product, the crew peels back the stages of the restoration; revealing what makes this 1971 Hemi Shaker Cuda special.

programme.desc: The crew finishes the build of the ultimate Mustang Sleeper for Antonio and Andres - a California Special powered by a Coyote Aluminator; Phil wants a '49 Chevy pick-up like the one he rode in as a child, but the truck is a disassembled puzzle.

programme.title: FantomWorks
programme.desc: Chris asks FantomWorks to breathe new life into a 1951 Mercury Woody that was sitting in a chicken coop for thirty years; Dan's 1970 Mustang Boss arrives with a long list of problems and the speed of a sea slug.

programme.title: Junkyard Empire
programme.desc: When Andy decides to take another crack at the world speed record for tow trucks in his Racing Wrecker, Bobby plans to take him on in a 1979 Zephyr with a hot new engine; neither expects a third racer to show up with a sleeper that wakes everyone up.

programme.title: Garage Squad
programme.desc: A vandalized 1969 Chevrolet Camaro attempts to make a comeback after 27 years on blocks.

programme.title: Roadworthy Rescues
programme.desc: Derek teams up with his brother Sean to convert a 1966 Oldsmobile F-85 from a wannabe drag racer into a timeless cruiser; it'll take more than a paint job to make this car street-able, as the guys discover the engine is keeping a horrible secret.

programme.title: Roadworthy Rescues
programme.desc: Derek Bieri and Dave Chappelle find an old dually among a flock of chickens; with the goal of building this rig into a car-hauling shop truck, Derek sets his sights on major performance upgrades, while Dave gets to work on a custom suspension setup.

programme.title: Roadworthy Rescues
programme.desc: Derek enlists Steve Dulcich to help put the muscle back into a derelict Dodge Coronet. But with a completely seized drivetrain, the guys will have to replace everything on this car if they hope to make the 500-mile road trip back to Nashville.

programme.title: Roadworthy Rescues
programme.desc: Derek heads to Alabama in search of a Bandit replica; instead, he finds a Trans Am that's the wrong year, wrong color, wrong engine and has clearly been in a wreck; that won't stop Derek from attempting to turn it into a car worthy of Burt himself.

programme.title: Roadworthy Rescues
programme.desc: Derek and his brother Sean head back to their family farm in North Dakota; intent on building a goin'-to-town rig for the old farmstead, they dig out a 1971 Chevrolet Chevelle sedan that's buried in cow pies and has a waterlogged engine.

programme.title: Roadworthy Rescues
programme.desc: In need of a new riding lawn mower, Derek heads east to find himself a 1950 Ford 8N tractor; with a cracked engine block and a bees' nest for a battery, Derek will have to revisit his farming routes to make this implement operational.

programme.title: Roadworthy Rescues
programme.desc: Amid the cornfields of Michigan, Derek discovers a '37 Chevy Deluxe he wants to drive to GM headquarters in Detroit; but it's been off the road for over 20 years and is going to put up a fight to make the 150-mile journey.

programme.title: Roadworthy Rescues
programme.desc: Derek and Sean Bieri head back to Zweifel Motors in the Black Hills of South Dakota to revive an Oldsmobile station wagon Derek has been eyeing for 16 years.

programme.title: Roadworthy Rescues
programme.desc: Steve Dulcich returns along with the long-lost Vanishing Paint Challenger; Derek and Steve pull out VP's automatic 727 in favor of a manual T56 and set their sights for a local road course, where they take on a last-generation Challenger RT.

programme.title: Roadworthy Rescues
programme.desc: Derek goes off the deep end with an '80s icon, the DeLorean; it's been wrecked, painted, and doesn't run, but Derek and his friends change all that with a good old junkyard LS.

programme.title: Roadworthy Rescues
programme.desc: Derek and Sean Bieri head back to Zweifel Motors in the Black Hills of South Dakota to revive an Oldsmobile station wagon Derek has been eyeing for 16 years.

programme.title: Turn Up The 00s Soft Rock
programme.desc: Turn up your speakers to 11 for 30 of the finest soft rock tracks from the noughties! Starting in 2000, featuring tracks from Keane, Nickleback Snow Patrol & Evanescence

programme.title: Soft Metal Monday
programme.desc: Kicking off your week with the finest in Soft Metal! From Aerosmith, Bon Jovi & Foreigner to Bonnie Tyler, Heart & Meatloaf.

programme.title: Backtrack: Soft Rock 2015-1980
programme.desc: In reverse: Starting in 2015, we're going back 35 years with timeless, soft rock tracks & big power ballads!

programme.title: Blazing Rock Ballads!
programme.desc: The Biggest Ballads from the royals of rock! From Queen, Bon Jovi & Whitesnake to Meat Loaf, Nickleback & Evanescence.

programme.title: 100 Rock Ballads with Simon Bates
programme.desc: 9 hours of love, heartbreak, loss & personal struggle. Who better than Mr Our Tune Simon Bates with another rock marathon spanning 5 decades.

programme.title: Soft Metal Monday
programme.desc: Kicking off your week with the finest in Soft Metal! From Aerosmith, Bon Jovi & Foreigner to Bonnie Tyler, Heart & Meatloaf.

programme.title: Turn Up The 00s Soft Rock
programme.desc: Turn up your speakers to 11 for 30 of the finest soft rock tracks from the noughties! Starting in 2000, featuring tracks from Keane, Nickleback Snow Patrol & Evanescence

programme.title: Robin Banks 80s Antiques Rockshow
programme.desc: Crammed full with extraordinary finds, hidden treasures, and plenty of old relics! From the Stones and Genesis, to KISS and INXS - how many of these family heirlooms do you own?

programme.title: 80s v 90s Rock Legends!
programme.desc: 30 hit songs, 15 top rock legends - one track as they were in the 80s, and another in the 90s - simple!

programme.title: Monsters of Rock! 2000-2009
programme.desc: A definitive 6 hour marathon of 00s rock anthems in order! From Alien Ant Farm to The Arctic Monkeys, Fall Out Boy to The Foo Fighters, Weezer to the White Stripes.

programme.title: Bad Teacher
programme.desc: A rude, drug-abusing educator vies with a perky colleague for the attentions of a rich and handsome substitute teacher.

programme.title: The Nutty Professor
programme.desc: A 450lb scientist falls for his new colleague, but out on a date, he's humiliated by a nightclub comedian about his weight. Upset and depressed, he takes a potion he's only tested previously on hamsters. He ends up turning into a svelte and cool-talking babe-magnet.

programme.title: Nutty Professor II: The Klumps
programme.desc: A guy is getting married, but his alter-ego keeps breaking through. Determined to rid himself of his pesky partner, he extracts his alter-ego's genes, but an accident and a dog hair see the later-ego take on his own life. Unaware of his existence, the man and his wife perfect their new rejuvenation formula and their fortune seems assured until his alter-ego steals it.

programme.title: Galaxy Quest
programme.desc: The stars of a 1970s sci-fi show - now scraping a living through re-runs and sci-fi conventions - are beamed aboard an alien spacecraft. Believing the cast's heroic on-screen dramas are historical documents of real-life adventures, the band of aliens turn to the ailing celebrities for help in their quest to overcome the oppressive regime in their solar system.

programme.title: Superbad
programme.desc: Two inseparable best friends navigate the last weeks of high school and are invited to a gigantic house party. Together with their nerdy friend, they spend a long day trying to score enough alcohol to supply the party and inebriate two girls in order to kick-start their sex lives before they go off to college. Their quest is complicated after one of them falls in with two inept cops who are determined to show him a good time.

programme.title: Horrible Bosses
programme.desc: Nick, Dale and Kurt all despise their bosses, but who would be crazy enough to quit their jobs in such poor economic times? The trio drunkenly and hypothetically discuss how to kill their bosses, and before they know it, they've hired a murder consultant to help them pull off the three deeds.

programme.title: Role Models
programme.desc: Danny is sour after driving away his girlfriend, and Wheeler is into anything wearing a skirt. The two get into a fight with a trucker and choose community service over a jail term.

programme.title: Nacho Libre
programme.desc: Brother Ignacio is an orphanage chef who cooks up a plan to earn money for the kids by becoming a Mexican wrestling star. First, he must don a leotard.

programme.title: Love Actually
programme.desc: Weaving in and out of the love lives of eight loosely inter-related couples. The bachelor Prime Minister falls for his personal assistant, his brother-in-law is flirting with one of his colleagues, a writer heads off to France and pursues an affair with a maid, and an 11-year-old boy asks his father for advice on matters of the heart.

programme.title: You, Me and Dupree
programme.desc: Carl is in seventh heaven when he marries his gorgeous girlfriend Molly in Hawaii. After a blissful honeymoon, they get back to find best man Dupree jobless, penniless and homeless. When Carl offers him a place to crash, he has no idea of the havoc that he is about to cause.

programme.title: Dumb and Dumber To
programme.desc: Twenty years after their last adventure, good-hearted, yet dimwitted best friends, Harry Dunne and Lloyd Christmas head out in search for Harry's long lost daughter, and Lloyd's in love again.

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2
programme.desc: Parenting and marriage is becoming tougher and tougher for Toula and her husband Ian. Not only has their relationship lost some of its spark, but they're also dealing with a rebellious teenage daughter who clashes with Greek traditions. On top of that, Toula must contend with aging parents and the endless needs of cousins and friends. When a shocking family secret comes to light, the entire Portokalos clan makes plans to come together for an even bigger wedding than before.

programme.title: Pixels
programme.desc: Video game experts are recruited by the military to fight 1980s-era video game characters who have attacked New York.

programme.title: The Blues Brothers
programme.desc: After his release from prison, Jake reunites with his brother, Elwood -- collectively known as the `Blues Brothers'. Jake's first task is to save the orphanage the brothers grew up in from closing, by raising 5000 dollars to pay back taxes. The two are convinced they can earn the money by getting their old band back together. However, after playing several gigs and making a few enemies, including the police, the brothers face daunting odds to deliver the money on time.

programme.title: Disaster Movie
programme.desc: Over the course of one evening, an unsuspecting group of twenty-somethings find themselves bombarded by a series of natural disasters and catastrophic events.

programme.title: Sixteen Candles
programme.desc: A teen suffers the pain of adolescence as she longs for Mr Right while fending off the advances of the class clown.

programme.title: Just Friends
programme.desc: An LA record producer returns to his New Jersey hometown ten years after being rejected by his high-school cheerleader crush. Having made the transformation from no-hope geek to Greek god womaniser and with his friend still single, he embarks on a second seduction strategy that does not always go to plan.

programme.title: Alfie
programme.desc: In an update of the 1966 Lewis Gilbert version, the eponymous Alfie is transposed to Manhattan and working as a chauffeur. His conquests include older woman Liz, lonely Nikki and Lonette, his best friend's girl. However, he begins to learn bitter truths about himself and the way he treats women and, by the end of the film, he discovers a degree of humility.

programme.title: Mr. Deeds
programme.desc: Deeds is much-loved in his small town, but following the death of a long-lost uncle, who also happens to be a billionaire tycoon, Deeds inherits a fortune and heads for the big city to run his uncle's company. When a media frenzy ensues surrounding Deeds' inheritance, reporter Babe Bennett goes undercover to out Deeds as the small-town fool she thinks he is.

programme.title: The Cinema List: Saturday Night
programme.desc: To celebrate the release of the film `Saturday Night', we explore 50 years of hilarious films from the SNL cast - including `Wayne's World', `Bridesmaids' and more.

programme.title: David Brent: Life on the Road
programme.desc: David Brent is on tour with his band `Foregone Conclusion.' However, tickets sales are not enough to keep the band afloat so Brent has to dip into his pension. Meanwhile, he is being filmed for what he believes will be a documentary, like Martin Scorsese did with The Rolling Stones, but it if for a `where are they now' style documentary.

programme.title: The Longest Yard
programme.desc: Paul `Wrecking' Crewe was a revered football superstar back in his day, but that time has since faded. When a messy drunk driving incident lands him in jail, Paul finds he was specifically requested by Warden Hazen, a duplicitous prison official well aware of Paul's athletic skills. Paul has been assigned the task of assembling a team of convicts, to square off in a big football game against the sadistic guards.

programme.title: Nacho Libre
programme.desc: Brother Ignacio is an orphanage chef who cooks up a plan to earn money for the kids by becoming a Mexican wrestling star. First, he must don a leotard.

programme.title: Brewster's Millions
programme.desc: After losing his position as a minor-league pitcher, Montgomery Brewster learns his great-uncle has left him 300 million dollars. To inherit it, Brewster must spend 30 million in 30 days under a complicated set of rules that forbid him from donating too much to charity or retaining any new assets when the period is up. Unable to share details about the will's odd conditions with anyone, Brewster sets out to spend his money under the stern eye of paralegal Angela Drake.

programme.title: The Holdovers
programme.desc: Forced to spend Christmas break with a handful of students, a curmudgeonly instructor at a New England prep school develops an unlikely bond with a brainy troublemaker and the head cook.

programme.title: Baywatch
programme.desc: When a plot by a dangerous criminal organisation endangers the beach, Mitch Buchannon leads his elite squad of lifeguards on a mission to prove that one doesn't need to wear a badge to save the bay.

programme.title: Dumb and Dumber To
programme.desc: Twenty years after their last adventure, good-hearted, yet dimwitted best friends, Harry Dunne and Lloyd Christmas head out in search for Harry's long lost daughter, and Lloyd's in love again.

programme.title: The Intern
programme.desc: Ben Whittaker, a retired widower in his 70s becomes senior intern at a fashion based e-commerce company. Jules Ostin, the founder, while first hesitant, soon learns to respect and even like her new intern despite their age difference.

programme.title: Horrible Bosses
programme.desc: Nick, Dale and Kurt all despise their bosses, but who would be crazy enough to quit their jobs in such poor economic times? The trio drunkenly and hypothetically discuss how to kill their bosses, and before they know it, they've hired a murder consultant to help them pull off the three deeds.

programme.title: Mean Girls
programme.desc: New student Cady Heron gets welcomed into the top of the social food chain by an elite group of popular girls called the Plastics, ruled by the conniving queen bee Regina George. However, when Cady makes the major misstep of falling for Regina's ex-boyfriend, she soon finds herself caught in their crosshairs.

programme.title: Housesitter
programme.desc: Newton Davis builds a dream home for his childhood sweetheart and is promptly dumped. Devastated, he seeks solace in the arms of a waitress, but sneaks off into the night once he's had his fun. The spurned waitress exacts her revenge by moving into the empty house and masquerading as Newton's wife. At this stage, things start getting complicated.

programme.title: Twins
programme.desc: Two very different twin brothers were born as a result of a genetic experiment. Following their birth, the flawless Julius grew up on a paradise island, while the less-than-perfect Vincent was sent to an orphanage. Now, many years later, Vincent is a thief and con man with huge debts. What will Julius think when he searches for his long-lost twin and finds him in jail?

programme.title: Scott Pilgrim vs. the World
programme.desc: Scott Pilgrim plays bass guitar in a struggling Toronto-based band and pines after his ex-girlfriend, now a success in her own band. At a party he meets Ramona Flowers and instantly is smitten, but in his pursuit of her he is attacked by Matthew Patel who informs Scott that he is the first of seven evil exes that Scott will have to defeat in order to win Ramona.

programme.title: The Cinema List: Saturday Night
programme.desc: To celebrate the release of the film `Saturday Night', we explore 50 years of hilarious films from the SNL cast - including `Wayne's World', `Bridesmaids' and more.

programme.title: Mr. Deeds

When a media frenzy ensues surrounding Deeds' inheritance, reporter Babe Bennett goes undercover to out Deeds as the small-town fool she thinks he is.

programme.title: Pixels
programme.desc: Video game experts are recruited by the military to fight 1980s-era video game characters who have attacked New York.

programme.title: Parenthood
programme.desc: An over-protective dad, determined to do a better job than his own distant father, anxiously dotes on his troubled eight-year-old son. His brother, meanwhile, strives to mould his toddler daughter into an academic high-flyer, and his sister struggles with two rebellious, angst-ridden teenagers.

programme.title: Rumours
programme.desc: Leaders of the world's wealthiest democracies become spectacles of incompetence, contending with increasingly surreal obstacles as night falls in the misty woods and they realise they are suddenly alone.

programme.title: You, Me and Dupree
programme.desc: Carl is in seventh heaven when he marries his gorgeous girlfriend Molly in Hawaii. After a blissful honeymoon, they get back to find best man Dupree jobless, penniless and homeless. When Carl offers him a place to crash, he has no idea of the havoc that he is about to cause.

programme.title: You've Got Mail
programme.desc: Two rival bookstore owners are unaware that they are conducting a secret romance with each other on the Internet. When they discover the truth, they must prevent their business rivalry from interfering with their growing personal intimacy.

programme.title: Pixels
programme.desc: Video game experts are recruited by the military to fight 1980s-era video game characters who have attacked New York.

programme.title: Nacho Libre
programme.desc: Brother Ignacio is an orphanage chef who cooks up a plan to earn money for the kids by becoming a Mexican wrestling star. First, he must don a leotard.

programme.title: The Men Who Stare at Goats
programme.desc: A reporter in Iraq may just have the story of a lifetime when he meets Lyn Cassady, a guy who claims to be a former member of the US Army's New Earth Army, a unit that employs paranormal powers in their missions.

programme.title: The Cinema List: Saturday Night
programme.desc: To celebrate the release of the film `Saturday Night', we explore 50 years of hilarious films from the SNL cast - including `Wayne's World', `Bridesmaids' and more.

programme.title: Crazy Rich Asians
programme.desc: Rachel Chu is happy to accompany her longtime boyfriend, Nick, to his best friend's wedding in Singapore. She's also surprised to learn that Nick's family is extremely wealthy and he's considered one of the country's most eligible bachelors. Thrust into the spotlight, Rachel must now contend with jealous socialites, quirky relatives and something far, far worse: Nick's disapproving mother.

programme.title: It's Complicated
programme.desc: When attending their son's college graduation, a couple reignite the spark in their relationship. However, the complication lies in the fact that they are divorced and he has remarried.

programme.title: Bad Teacher
programme.desc: A rude, drug-abusing educator vies with a perky colleague for the attentions of a rich and handsome substitute teacher.
